definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
neo-Platonism (philosophical system combining Platonism with mysticism)
pinyin: xin1 Bo2 la1 tu2 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: This is somewhat like platonic cross-sex friendships.
sentences.chinese: 这有点像柏拉图式的异性友谊。

sentences.english: On theory of idea philosophy of Platos objective idealism;
sentences.chinese: 关于或具有柏拉图主义特征。

sentences.english: Amicus Plato Amicus Aristotle, send Magis Amicus Veritas .
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图，亚里士多德传授以马吉斯真理。

sentences.english: Neoplatonism was one of the important thoughts of the Renaissance.
sentences.chinese: 新柏拉图主义是文艺复兴时期重要思想之一。

sentences.english: Confucius and Plato have high expectation on music's social functions.
sentences.chinese: 孔子和柏拉图对于音乐的社会功能都给予了高度重视。

sentences.english: The model of Plato's Ladder aptly describes the logic behind the theory.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图的阶梯模型恰当地描述了三段论所蕴含的逻辑。

sentences.english: Plato very early on played a part in development of Christian doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图很早就在基督教教义的发展历程中起作用了。

sentences.english: Plato wrote a series of letters that we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们握有柏拉图所写的一系列书信。

sentences.english: The great philosopher Plato is also known for some of his quotations on love.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的哲学家柏拉图也有一些脍炙人口的爱情名言。

sentences.english: You may remember Plato's allegory of the cave.
sentences.chinese: 你可能记得柏拉图关于洞穴的讽刺。

sentences.english: What is the allegory of the Cave of Plato?
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图的山洞之喻是指什么？

sentences.english: In other words, no Platonic cities in speech.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说谈话中不带柏拉图式的城邦论点。

sentences.english: If Plato is a fascist, ? what does that make you?
sentences.chinese: 如果柏拉图是一名法西斯份子，那你们又该如何自称？

sentences.english: Here we may seem to have arrived at a true universal or Platonic idea.
sentences.chinese: 这里我们似乎达到了真正的共相，或者柏拉图的理念。

sentences.english: The core of Plato's The Republic is idealism.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图《理想国》的理论核心是理念论。

definition: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
